target_work.title: Techno-Feudalism: What Killed Capitalism
target_work.author: Yanis Varoufakis
target_work.description: Argues that capitalism has mutated into techno-feudalism through the rise of cloud capital — platform-based algorithmic systems that have replaced market dynamics with feudal rent extraction. Central to the argument is that Big Tech platforms like Amazon and Meta are not traditional capitalist enterprises but cloud fiefs that extract rent rather than profit.

prior_works.title: The Global Minotaur
prior_works.author: Yanis Varoufakis
prior_works.description: Analyzes the global economic system through the metaphor of the Minotaur — America as the beast that consumed the world surplus to maintain global equilibrium
prior_works.relationship_hint: Established the metamorphosis framework and the idea that capitalism periodically transforms itself

prior_works.title: Talking to My Daughter About the Economy
prior_works.author: Yanis Varoufakis
prior_works.description: Popular economics book that introduces key Varoufakis concepts in accessible form
prior_works.relationship_hint: First mention of the weird hypothesis that capitalism may have been replaced by something worse

prior_works.title: Adults in the Room
prior_works.author: Yanis Varoufakis
prior_works.description: Memoir of the Greek debt crisis negotiations as finance minister
prior_works.relationship_hint: Provides biographical context and lived experience with institutional power dynamics

research_question: How did Varoufakis's Marxist intellectual formation shape the conceptual vocabulary and argumentative architecture of Techno-Feudalism?
strategy_summary:
The analytical strategy for Yanis Varoufakis's corpus centers on tracking his highly distinct conceptual vocabulary ('technofeudalism', 'cloud capital', 'global minotaur') across a radically diverse set of genres (academic monograph, memoir, speculative fiction, popular economics). Because Varoufakis frequently embeds dense political economy within narrative structures, the pipeline initiates with Phase 0.5 (Deep Text Profiling) using a large-context model to capture both argumentative architecture and narrative emplotment in the target work. Phase 1.0 expands the baseline target profiling by explicitly appending economic and rhetorical supplementary chains, preparing a rich, 150k-character distilled target profile.

Given the massive scale of the prior works (e.g., the 1.3M-character 'Adults in the Room'), a dedicated Phase 1.8 (Prior Work Profiling) is introduced. This phase ensures each massive book is structurally summarized and its narrative arcs mapped before the deep genealogical scanning in Phase 2.0. By using Gemini for text profiling and Opus for the deep comparative synthesis, the pipeline balances massive context ingestion with rigorous, dialectical concept-tracking. The final phases synthesize how Varoufakis recycles, mutates, and strategically escalates his economic theories across audiences and genres.

phases.rationale: Receives the raw target text ('Varoufakis-4') to generate a foundational summary of thesis architecture, chapter dependencies, and narrative structure. Gemini is used to handle the 493K-character text natively.

Consumes Phase 0.5 outputs and the raw target text. Runs the core genealogical profiling plus economic and rhetorical supplementary chains. The max_context_chars_override is expanded to 150k to pass this deeply distilled, multi-engine profile downstream to the per-work phases.
Receives the distilled 150K-character target profile from Phase 1.0 and assesses each prior work's strategic relationship to it, determining downstream scanning priority.

Because all four prior works are massive books (up to 1.3M chars), this phase consumes the raw prior work texts using Gemini to produce deep structural and narrative summaries. This guarantees Phase 2.0 has high-signal context rather than blindly scanning millions of tokens.

Receives the distilled target profile (1.0), relationship metadata (1.5), and prior work profiles (1.8). Conducts deep dimensional comparison to find concept appropriations and methodological evolution.
Aggregates the per-work concept traces from Phase 2.0 to construct unified evolutionary timelines, map convergence/divergence, and identify conditions of possibility.
Consumes all upstream synthesis data (Phases 1.0 through 3.0) to compose the final deliverables, including the executive summary, idea timelines, and the author's overall prosopographic profile.
